acts.title: A lone traveler stumbles into a trading post.
acts.summary: Jack, a weary survivor, enters Red Rock Trading Post seeking supplies and rest after a long trek across the Mojave desert. He meets the trader, Doc Wells, who is expecting a special shipment of beef jerky from an old acquaintance in Novac.

acts.title: A delayed delivery causes frustration among the tr
acts.summary: Doc Wells grows impatient waiting for the beef jerky, which is crucial to his business. He bickers with the trader at Nellis Airfield about the shipment's status, while Jack tries to negotiate a better price on his own goods. Meanwhile, rumors circulate that a gang of raiders has been targeting trad

acts.title: A surprise attack forces a desperate defense.
acts.summary: The raiders strike at Red Rock Trading Post, catching Doc and Jack off guard. In the ensuing chaos, valuable goods are stolen or destroyed, and the trader is gravely injured. Jack must fend off the attackers and try to rescue any survivors.

acts.title: The consequences of violence and the power of frie
acts.summary: Doc survives his injuries, but Red Rock Trading Post is severely damaged. Jack helps rebuild the post and tends to Doc's recovery. Meanwhile, the trader from Nellis Airfield shows up with a new shipment of beef jerky, revealing he was secretly working with the raiders all along. Jack must decide whe

acts.title: A new path emerges from the ashes of betrayal.
acts.summary: Jack chooses to stand by Doc, rejecting the trader's offer. Together, they plan to expand Red Rock Trading Post into a thriving hub for travelers in the Mojave desert. Jack also decides to explore Novac and confront his old acquaintance about the missing beef jerky shipment.

recent_scripts.content: "Hey everyone, this is Julie on Radio Appalachia at 7 o'clock in the morning! That fresh mountain air fills your lungs as the sun rises over these beautiful hills. If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone. Remember, we've got each other's backs in these uncertain times. Stay hopeful and keep moving forward together!"

recent_scripts.content:
"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone." 

Hey there, friends! It's your girl Julie again on Appalachia Radio. I just wanted to share a little rumor I heard floating around the wasteland lately.

Word is, there's this secret underground bunker hidden somewhere in the woods near Beckley. Apparently, it's filled with pre-war tech and junk that's still in perfect working order! Can you imagine? I mean, I've seen some pretty sweet loot in my travels, but a whole stash of untouched pre-war goodies? That'd be like finding the motherlode!

Of course, no one can seem to pinpoint the exact location. It's all just whispers and hunches at this point. But hey, if you stumble upon something, you know who to call... or rather, tune in to! Until next time, stay safe out there, and keep those ears open for more rumors and goodies. "Take Me Home, Country Roads" is up next - enjoy!"

recent_scripts.content:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard there's this super rare robot out in the wilds somewhere - a Tinkers' Workshop bot that can fix almost anything. Someone told me it's hidden away in an old factory. Word is, it's still operational too! Can you imagine having your own personal repair drone following you around? That'd be awesome.

Apparently, there's also rumors about some sort of secret bunker deep under the earth here. Like a pre-war fallout shelter or something. I don't know if any of that's true, but wouldn't it be amazing to find a safe haven like that?

Anyway, enough about wild stories for now! Here's "Guitar Man" by Elvis Presley - a classic tune always good for a sing-along! Let me know what you think of it in the comments.

recent_scripts.content:
"Hey there, if you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone. Now, I know we've all heard rumors flying around the wasteland about strange stuff happening out here in Appalachia. 

I heard from someone who swears it's true that there's a hidden underground bunker beneath Morgantown, stocked with pre-war supplies. Word is, the entrance is camouflaged to blend in with the surrounding terrain, so you've gotta know where to look.

Another thing - apparently, there have been reports of glowing plants sprouting up in areas around the Ash Heap. Now, I'm no botanist, but that sounds kinda freaky to me! Has anyone else seen anything like that? 

Anyway, just wanted to share those tidbits... and remember, stay safe out there, and keep on keepin' on!"

recent_scripts.content:
Welcome home, Appalachia. So, I heard this rumor floating around the wasteland about a secret underground bunker hidden somewhere near Harpers Ferry. Apparently, it's supposed to be filled with pre-war tech and supplies, untouched since the Great War. Word is, some folks have actually seen lights on at night, but nobody's been brave enough to investigate further. I mean, can you imagine what kind of treasures could be down there? It's giving me goosebumps just thinking about it! 

Of course, this could all be just a wild story, but hey, wouldn't it be something if it turned out to be true? A little bit of hope never hurt anyone. So keep your eyes and ears open, Appalachians, and maybe we'll uncover the truth behind this bunker rumor together. Until then, stay safe out there! 

And remember, no matter where you roam in these hills, 'Take Me Home, Country Roads' is always playing in our hearts.

recent_scripts.content:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys. So I heard this rumor from someone who claims their friend saw some kind of... Well, they said it was like a giant, mutated tick! Attacking people and draining them dry out in the Cranberry Glades. Can you imagine? Like something straight out of a bad horror movie.

I don't know if I believe it, but it's got me thinking about those weird insects we've seen around. Maybe they're more than just pests. Anyway, here's some real music to calm your nerves after that wild story - John Denver's "Take Me Home, Country Roads." It never gets old, does it?

recent_scripts.content:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

So, I heard this rumor floating around about Grafton Steel. Apparently, some brave soul went in to grab some scrap metal recently. And supposedly, the whole place is crawling with Scorched! Now, I don't know if that's true or just old wives' tale, but you might wanna steer clear of there for now.

On a more positive note, have you heard about the secret garden hidden in the Abandoned Bog? No? Well, not many do. But apparently, it's full of wild flowers and greenery, untouched by the radiation. It's like a little oasis out there in the wasteland! I mean, who knows how long it'll stay that way, but for now, it sounds like a nice spot to rest your boots.

That's all for now folks. Stay safe, and keep those hopes high! Appalachia Radio, always here for you.

recent_scripts.content:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

So I heard this rumor going 'round the wasteland... apparently there's a hidden vault deep in the forest northwest of Harpers Ferry. Supposedly it wasn't one of the dozen or so public vaults, but like, an experimental or prototype one or something? Word is, it's super heavily secured with all sorts of fancy traps and security systems.

Now I don't know if there's any truth to this, it could just be some wild speculation. But supposedly the entrance is hidden behind a waterfall on the Kanawha River. If that's true, it'd be a real challenge to get in, you know? Like, Vault-Tec didn't make things easy!

Anyway, I thought I'd share that tidbit, even if it's just a rumor for now. Who knows, maybe one of you intrepid explorers will stumble upon it and find out the truth! Stay curious out there.

That's all for now, folks. Keep on keeping on in Appalachia!

recent_scripts.content:
Welcome home, Appalachia.

So I heard from a friend of a friend that there's been some... unusual sightings out in the Cranberry Glades. Apparently folks have spotted glowing plants and trees, like something from one of those old sci-fi movies. Now, I'm not saying it's true or anything, but word is, if you touch 'em, they give off this weird energy that can heal your injuries. Like a natural radroach remedy! (laughs) Wouldn't that be amazing? Nature's cure-all.

Of course, there's always the chance it's just some wild tale spread by wanderers trying to impress each other with tall stories. You know how it is out here - everyone's got a rumor or two. But hey, even if it's not true, it's fun to dream, right? A magical glade where you can lick your wounds and be on your merry way? Sign me up! (smiling) Anyway, I just thought I'd pass along the whisperings for now. Maybe we'll find out more about these glowing flora someday soon.

Stay curious, Appalachia!

recent_scripts.content:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys. You know, I heard from someone who knows someone that there's been some pretty wild sightings around the Cranberry Glades lately. Like, have you heard about those glowing... things? No? Well, allegedly they've been spotted flitting around at night near the old resort.

Now, I don't know if this is just some tall tale or not. It does sound pretty far-fetched, right? But hey, we live in a world where Brahmins can have two heads and radroaches are as big as cars, so who knows?

Word is that these glowing critters might even be attracted to the resort's old light fixtures. So if you're out there exploring, keep an eye out for some ethereal nightlife, 'kay? And remember, no matter what weirdness we find in this post-apocalyptic wonderland, at least we've got good tunes to take our minds off it. Here's some more John Denver for ya - "Sunshine on My Shoulders".
